Chapter 19 – A tree of the Al-Harram

titles.ar: بَابُ كَرَاهَةِ أَنْ يُؤْخَذَ مِنْ تُرَابِ الْبَيْتِ وَ حَصَاهُ
titles.en: Chapter 17 – Abhorrence of taking from the soil of the House (Kabah) and its pebbles
Chapter 18 – Abhorrence of staying in Makkah

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: صحيح - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (7/80)

narrator_chain.text: مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ يَحْيَى عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ الْحُسَيْنِ عَنْ عَلِيِّ بْنِ الْحَكَمِ وَ صَفْوَانَ عَنِ الْعَلَاءِ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ مُسْلِمٍ عَنْ أَبِي جَعْفَرٍ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ

text: لَا يَنْبَغِي لِلرَّجُلِ أَنْ يُقِيمَ بِمَكَّةَ سَنَةً قُلْتُ كَيْفَ يَصْنَعُ قَالَ يَتَحَوَّلُ عَنْهَا وَ لَا يَنْبَغِي لِأَحَدٍ أَنْ يَرْفَعَ بِنَاءً فَوْقَ الْكَعْبَةِ.
وَ رُوِيَ أَنَّ الْمُقَامَ بِمَكَّةَ يُقْسِي الْقُلُوبَ

en.hubeali: Muhammad Bin Yahya, from Muhammad Bin Al Husayn, from Ali Bin Al Hakam, and Safwan, from Al A’ala, from Muhammad Bin Muslim,

(It has been narrated) from Abu Ja’far<sup>asws</sup> having said: ‘It is not befitting for the man that he stays in Makkah for a year’. I said, ‘How should he deal with it?’ He<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘’He should transfer from it. And, it is not befitting for anyone that he raises a construction above the Kabah’.
And it is reported that the staying in Makkah hardens the hearts’.
en.sarwar: 1. Muhammad ibn Yahya has narrated from Muhammad ibn al-Husayn from Ali ibn al-Hakam from and Safwan from al-‘Ala’ from Muhammad ibn Muslim who has said the following: “Abu Ja’far, ‘Alayhi al-Salam, has said, ‘It is not proper for a man to stay in Makkah for one year.’ I then asked, ‘What should he do?’ He (the Imam) said, ‘He must move out, and it is not proper for anyone to build anything higher than al-Ka‘bah.’” It is narrated that staying in Makkah hardens (removes good feelings from) one’s heart.

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: مرسل - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (7/80)

narrator_chain.text: عَلِيُّ بْنُ إِبْرَاهِيمَ عَنْ أَبِيهِ عَنِ ابْنِ أَبِي عُمَيْرٍ عَمَّنْ ذَكَرَهُ عَنْ ذَرِيحٍ عَنْ أَبِي بَصِيرٍ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ

text: إِذَا فَرَغْتَ مِنْ نُسُكِكَ فَارْجِعْ فَإِنَّهُ أَشْوَقُ لَكَ إِلَى الرُّجُوعِ .

en.hubeali: Ali Bin Ibrahim, from his father, from Ibn Abu Umeyr, from the one who mentioned it, from Zareeh, from Abu Baseer,
(It has been narrated) from Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> having said: ‘When you are free from performing your rituals, return, for it would be more desirous for you to the returning’.
en.sarwar: 2. Ali ibn Ibrahim has narrated from his father from ibn abu ‘Umayr from those whom he has mentioned from Dharih from abu Basir who has said the following: “Abu ‘Abd Allah, ‘Alayhi al-Salam, has said, ‘When you complete your nusuk (acts of ‘Umrah and or Hajj) go back; it leaves you with more desire to return to Makkah.’”
